titleStmt.title: An Oeulo-Motor System with Multi-Chip Neuromorphie Analog VLSI Control

analytic.title: An Oeulo-Motor System with Multi-Chip Neuromorphie Analog VLSI Control

abstract.p: A system emulating the functionality of a moving eye-hence the name oculo-motor system-has been built and successfully tested. It is made of an optical device for shifting the field of view of an image sensor by up to 45 Â° in any direction, four neuromorphic analog VLSI circuits implementing an oculo-motor control loop, and some off-the-shelf electronics. The custom integrated circuits communicate with each other primarily by non-arbitrated address-event buses. The system implements the behaviors of saliency-based saccadic exploration, and smooth pursuit of light spots. The duration of saccades ranges from 45 ms to 100 ms, which is comparable to human eye performance. Smooth pursuit operates on light sources moving at up to 50 0 /s in the visual field.
